result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Request for Substitution against Judge Paul Bugenhagen, received on today's date.

  **Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen on 07-18-2022: Approved.**

09:36 AM Defendant Robert J Bruecker in court with attorney Justin L. Singleton.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Detective Shelly Fisher, of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Tempelis.
Cross examination by attorney Singleton.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Preliminary hearing on July 18, 2022 at 09:15 am.

09:37 AM Defendant Robert J Bruecker in court with attorney Justin L. Singleton.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court notes that the State filed a letter requesting to adjourn the matter as their witness was unavailable.
Attonrey Singleton does not object, however invokes the time limits and requests a prelim hearing within 20 days.
The Court will set a prelim hearing within the time limits requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:15 am.

DA is requesting to adjourn prelim for 7/01. State's witness not available. Court's response 6/20: Matter to remain on for scheduling-status on Prelim. due to Marsy's Law issue. Time limits have been waived. Defense counsel and Defendant may appear by Zoom if they would like.
Motion hearing on August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Objection to Pre-Adjudication Treatment of Any Person or Entity as a "Victim" filed by Defense

  **Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen on 06-09-2022: Schedule a motion hearing in August.**
Preliminary hearing on July 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant not to physically discipline any child.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victims A-C listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

09:13 AM Defendant Robert J Bruecker in court with attorney Justin L. Singleton.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
